title.narrative: Capacity Building of Pharmaceutical staff in DRC

description.narrative: Capacity building of pharmaceutical staff in 25 healthcare facilities inDRC

The project will improve the pharmaceutical services provided by 25 faith based healthcare facilities around the Evangelical Medical Centre Nyankunde, in Nyankunde District, DRC.
Medicines are a major component of any health system but access to medicines is still a huge problem in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) in Sub-Saharan Africa. This part of Africa has the highest incidence of infectious diseases and non-communicable diseases (NCDs). One contributing factor to lack of medicines is that most staff working in (church) health facilities are not trained, therefore pharmaceutical management is weak.
The project will work specifically on increasing the knowledge on essential pharmacy practices of staff responsible for the pharmacies; on increasing the availability of essential medicines and; on improving dispensing practices, in all 25 facilities and by the end of 2018.
The primary target group of the project will be personnel working in the pharmacy department of church health institutions (hospitals and health centers) that do not have trained pharmaceutical staff. The health personnel in turn serve directly thousands of patients. These patients are approximately 156,000 in the whole project catchment area.
